channel.title: [PI] Webclient Error
channel.description:
Hey well i have made a webclient using a PI Client.
I have tried it myself by going on the website and deleteing my cache then going on the webclient and the cache downloads fine.
But i have told 4 people to try load up the webclient and they all get the same error: 'Error click for details'.
But for me it actualy works and auto-downloads the cache..
What would the problem be?

item.title: [PI] Webclient Error
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

yah

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Webclient Error
item.dc:creator: @josh124 josh124
item.description:
@josh124 wrote:

Andy can you help me with the webclient now please?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Webclient Error
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“axecutor9090, post:11, topic:437533”]So the idiots before me don’t know how to troubleshoot.

This is what you need to do, The problem is that you are using JDK 1.7.0 Or Higher, You need to downgrade your Jdk to Jdk1.6.0_Any, Then delete the 1.7.0 Redo the paths for Jarmaker and make your jar.[/quote]

What the flying fuck.
First read this
http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/troubleshoot?s=t
Then after you have increased your intellect and know what troubleshooting is you should also read this http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/topics/newtojava/overview/index.html now that you know the definition of troubleshooting and the basics of java programing “you no longer have an excuse for HOMOEROTIC
IDIOSYNCRATIC messages you can look that one up for yourself :)”

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Webclient Error
item.dc:creator: @axecutor9090 axecutor9090
item.description:
@axecutor9090 wrote:

So the idiots before me don’t know how to troubleshoot.

This is what you need to do, The problem is that you are using JDK 1.7.0 Or Higher, You need to downgrade your Jdk to Jdk1.6.0_Any, Then delete the 1.7.0 Redo the paths for Jarmaker and make your jar.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Webclient Error
item.dc:creator: @josh124 josh124
item.description:
@josh124 wrote:

I Have… Someone try it now I’v just edit the client folder because andy said it wasn’t getting the Class files. but iv just this second re-done it. Someone try it please? And go to the home page and talk on chatbox so i know your trying it? Thanks

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Webclient Error
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“josh124, post:7, topic:437533”][quote author=Ruby Forums Coder link=topic=540239.msg3956015#msg3956015 date=1332759818]

Yeh but that shouldn’t stop it loading for people…

Jar it on your ip, or no-ip whatever you’re using. Then take a look at it. Remember and sign the .jar file.
[/quote]

I don’t understand what you mean Jar it on your IP\No-ip… I have signed it with a certificate i made from a tutorial… And i followed the exact tutorial and it still doesn’t work. :S

I have skype & Teamviewer[/quote]

jar it up on your Jarmaker… thats how you make the jar file in the first place…?

Read full topic

I have skype & Teamviewer

item.title: [PI] Webclient Error
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Because you jarred it on localhost, the ip is still set to 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0 somewhere.

Read full topic
